fields.description:
see EUCA-10031 for details of back-end implementation.

Capturing notes from 6/5 meeting...

- SCTP will not display the port range inputs when selected
- On Eucalyptus, SCTP option will display for VPC and non-VPC modes
- On AWS, SCTP option will display only when VPC is enabled (and selected)
- SCTP option will display for inbound rules on non-VPC and inbound/outbound rules on VPC setups
fields.summary: add custom protocol for security groups to support sctp

comments.body: [~kgill] please sync with [~dmitrii] prior to starting work on this, there will be a meeting sometime on 6/5 to discuss this ticket for 4.1.2

Per mgmt mtg 6/15: [~kgill] since this is a minor amount of work, and if people set it via CLI we need to be able to display it in the console anyway, might as well get support for this into 4.1.2. Please prioritize this work over 4.2. Thanks!
[~kgill] sure, I'll ping you when that setup gets updated.

[~kgill], if SCTP displays correctly in 4.1.2 then this ticket can be re-targeted to 4.2 (leave in backlog for now, can pull into sprint if we get everything else done). 

Wireframe at https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/3UD/Create+Security+Group covers custom protocol display and behavior.
[~kgill] 10.111.5.132 cloud updated and ready
[~kgill] I wrote an email explaining that we kicked off a new cloud for you to test on. Please refer to the link in the email for system information. The 5.132 cloud does not contain the fix.

[~jloza]: The security group with an SCTP rule displays just fine in the 4.1 console (screenshot attached), and I'm able to delete the rule via the console, so we can probably move this ticket to 4.2.
[~kgill], yep, if no add'l work required for this in 4.1, OK to change fixversion to 4.2.

[~kgill], I just had a customer request for this feature in the console this morning. Why can't we put the console code in and test with 4.1.2 when it merges? It's in release pending so the fix has been verified.
[~jloza]: IIRC we opted to punt this to 4.3 during a sprint planning meeting.  We haven't written any code to implement this in the console yet.
That was before. Customer request came today.
[~kgill] FYI, I updated this wireframe to address SCTP: https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/3UD/Create+Security+Group

[~jloza]: I have a few questions about the updated Create Security Group wireframe...

I don't understand the updated protocol choices spec'd in the wireframe.  We currently have the following choices for the protocol field...

{code}
RULE_PROTOCOL_CHOICES = (
    ('22', 'SSH (TCP port 22, for terminal access)'),
    ('3389', 'RDP (TCP port 3389, for Windows instances)'),
    ('80', 'HTTP (TCP port 80, for web servers)'),
    ('443', 'HTTPS (TCP port 443, for web servers)'),
    ('1433', 'MS SQL (TCP port 1433)'),
    ('3306', 'MySQL (TCP port 3306)'),
    ('110', 'POP3 (TCP port 110)'),
    ('995', 'POP3S (TCP port 995)'),
    ('389', 'LDAP (TCP port 389)'),
    ('143', 'IMAP (TCP port 143)'),
    ('465', 'SMTP (TCP port 465)'),
    ('tcp', 'Custom TCP'),
    ('udp', 'Custom UDP'),
    ('icmp', 'Custom ICMP'),
)
{code}

And I suggest we add the following line of code for the SCTP item after the 'Custom TPC' entry...

{code}
    ('sctp', 'Custom SCTP'),
{code}

I'm also not clear why the updated Create Security Group wireframe has a "Name or number" field, since the protocol numbers are automatically mapped in our console, and allowing those to be customized could potentially cause problems.  The console code that maps the protocol names to numbers is at https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/blob/master/eucaconsole/constants/internet_protocols.py

Finally, for the port range inputs, where does the "All traffic" come from?  Also, I don't think we'd want to hide the port range inputs when Custom SCTP, Custom TCP, or Custom ICMP are selected in the protocol input.

hi [~kgill],

You should probably read through the comment thread in the wireframe for why we need to support arbitrary custom protocols, that has been in the wireframe forever and is not new. However, you don't need to add that part for this ticket, it's something that should have been aded for VPC and apparently was overlooked. The only thing you need to add now is the SCTP stuff. 

All traffic is also mentioned in the comment thread. It's a VPC thing as well. 

You're right, ports need to be defined with custom protocols. 

Also, finally, please use the comment section on the wireframe to ask questions about the UI design instead of commenting here. That way they are threaded with the design for future reference.
[~kgill], we can implement against AWS though, right? We just can't test against Euca until the merge.
[~jloza], I'd like to confirm that we will still show port range for SCTP? If so, I think I'm done with this.

[~dkavanagh], wireframe says hide.

https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/3UD/Create+Security+Group

I saw your comment above "You're right, ports need to be defined with custom protocols."
SCTP is a custom protocol, right?
nope, sctp isn't custom. No port range for that. Issue description here is what we should do for SCTP behavior.
https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1538

verified against AWS only, since 4.1.2 isn't merged into euca back end yet. 

SCTP was a selectable option when "No VPC" was selected in VPC dropdown. SCTP should not be available when AWS security group is EC2 classic, it's not supported there and the op will fail. 

Screenshots attached.

That's fantastic. The decision to include sctp is made server-side, not client, so then we need additional stuff to hide that option when stuff outside the widget changes. This'll be fun (and probably ugly)

btw, I think doing this will also address the linked ticket (GUI-1978)
PR updated/simplified
Great job, [~dkavanagh]! UX review passed (ON AWS ONLY, can't check on Euca until 4.1.2 merge), ready for code review.
PR 1538 merged
Verified.  I was able to create a new security group using SCTP.
Released in 4.2
